lines.content: This is the chatbot `Torne`, short for `Torment Nexus`.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
2. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
2. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
3. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
3. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
4. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Torne.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Torne.main()`
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* class that handles text outputs for the chatbot.
* Takes in a text string, wraps it inside a pair of borderlines, and outputs it to the console
* @param text text string to be outputed.
* Outputs an error with the given text. The text will be prefixed by `ERROR:`, and
* is formatted using ANSI codes to be red (not working, using System.err)
* @param errorText text to be printed out as the error.
// TODO ANSI color codes no work
private static final ChatOutput OUTPUT = new ChatOutput();
* Checks for the existence of the required storage directories and files. Creates them if they do not exist.
* @Return True if storage files had to be created.
OUTPUT.error("Could not create tasks file: " + e.getMessage());
* Loads task data from storage at ./data/tasks.txt.
* If the directory or file does not exist, they are created.
* @return An ArrayList with the parsed tasks.

OUTPUT.error("Task storage file not found: " + e.getMessage());
* Saves the list of tasks to the default text file
* @param tasks List of tasks to be saved.
// make sure storage files exist first
OUTPUT.error("Could not write to task file: " + e.getMessage());
* Class that encapsulates a task that can be added to `Torne`.

* @return Task created from the input string.
* @throws TorneInvalidDataException if the input string is invalid.
public static Task fromStorageString(String input) throws TorneInvalidDataException, TorneInvalidCommandException {
// min length is 3. If less than that, raise error
throw new TorneInvalidDataException("Input task string does not have enough components");
// parse second component "1" / "0" for completion status
throw new TorneInvalidDataException("Completion status is invalid.");
throw new TorneInvalidDataException("Invalid todo storage string.");
throw new TorneInvalidDataException("Invalid deadline storage string.");
throw new TorneInvalidDataException("Invalid event storage string.");
throw new TorneInvalidDataException("Storage string task type code invalid.");
throw new TorneInvalidCommandException("Task cannot have an empty name");
* Returns a string used to store the task in a local file.
* @return String representation of task used for local storage.
TaskDeadline(String name, String by) throws TorneInvalidCommandException {
throw new TorneInvalidCommandException("Option /by cannot be empty");
// format based on the toString output of `Task`
* Task that starts and ends at specific datetimes.
TaskEvent(String name, String from, String to) throws TorneInvalidCommandException {
if (from == null || to == null || from.isBlank() || to.isBlank()) {
throw new TorneInvalidCommandException("Options /from and /to cannot be empty");
// format based on the toString output of `Task`
return String.format("[E]%s (from: %s to: %s)", super.toString(), from, to);
* Handles the list of tasks, as well as all operations concerning tasks.
* This class does not interface with input or output.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* Returns the `Task` at the specified position in this list.
* @param index index of the desired task. index is in [0, n-1].
* Removes the `Task` at the specified position in this list.
* @param index index of the desired task. index is in [0, n-1].
* Gets the list of tasks as a formatted string, with each task on a separate line.
// format based on the toString output of `Task`
* This is the main class for `Torne`.
* All the main commands are here.
private static final ChatOutput OUTPUT = new ChatOutput();
private static final String[] NO_ARGS = new String[0];

* Parses the string command and arguments that the user entered. The correct operation is then called. If the input
* is **invalid**, e.g. the command does not exist, nothing will be printed and the bot asks for another input.
* Invalid inputs have their own handling processes.
* @param input string input by the user
private void parseCommand(String input) throws TorneException {
// Check if input is a command, if not, give error message
// Command is not found in COMMANDS
throw new TorneInvalidCommandException(String.format("Command %s is not valid.", command));

// go through the args list and add the other args

throw new TorneInvalidCommandException("No value entered for flag " + argParts[0]);
// argument flag is invalid for the given command
String.format("Argument flag %s is invalid for command %s", argParts[0], command));

* Shows a greeting message, to be shown when user initialises Torne.
short for Torment Nexus, your F R I E N D L Y neighborhood chatbot :3
How may I help you today?""";
Aww, bye to you as well :c""";
